title: User Chrome hide this "browser-bottombox" in full screen.
content:
Hello everybody.

I have created the following rule in user chrome:

/* Brings Back The Original Statusbar At The Bottom Of The Screen */

  1. browser-bottombox { height: 20px; border-top: solid 1px #CCC;}

I'm really happy with this, except for the fact that it is visible all the time, so also in full screen.

Q: can I put a command in front so this hides in full screen? Been looking, trying for ages now.

Many THANKS for all your help!
creator: marc.verbeelen

title: How to add  Help => About Firefox in Firefox home page
content:
Hi,

Firefox is great but is there a way to add the Help => About Firefox webpage in Firefox home page? This is to simplify Firefox updates. Because although Firefox downloads updates, you still need to activate Help => About Firefox to update the Firefox version.

In Chrome you can add this to home page: chrome://settings/help and when you open Chrome it goes to this page and updates itself.

Does Firefox have the same capabilities so that we don't need to wait on users to click on Help => About Firefox to update Firefox?

Thanks and regards,

QB
creator: qb941g

title: john bermudez
content:
estoy descargando con ustedes un certificado electronico y no me deja este mensaje me sale. No se conectó: Posible problema de seguridad

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a apus20.cert.fnmt.es porque este sitio web requiere una conexión segura.

¿Qué puedes hacer al respecto?

Es probable que haya un problema con el sitio web y no hay nada que puedas hacer al respecto.

Si estás usando una red corporativa o un software antivirus, puedes contactarte con el equipo de asistencia técnica. También puedes notificarle al administrador del sitio sobre el problema.

Saber más…

title: Firefox Sync data lost after computer reset
content:
Hey all,

after 3 years I finally did a complete reset (all folders were kept, only full software reset) of my system hoping that Firefox Sync would after I reinstall Firefox and put in my registration data remember all my bookmarks / logins. However, after my login there is nothing there. I have the suspicion that Firefox thinks I just deleted all my bookmarks and it updated to Firefox Sync accordingly not with an empty space. I still have the data on my android phone which hasnt done a synchronization yet. Any help you guys can give me? Took quite some time to get all my setup arranged.

Thanks in advance!

Best, Seb

title: Videos Stop Playing when I'm Tabbed Out
content:
Whenever I leave a video playing in Firefox and open a different application in the foreground, the video stops playing after about 10 seconds. The audio will continue to play, but the video will freeze. I realized this when I tried to stream a YouTube video to a Discord call. I could see the frozen frame in the stream, and when I re-open Firefox, I could see the frozen frame for a split-second before the video resumed.

I've restarted my computer. I've gone into about:config and messed with every setting with the word "throttle" or "throttling" in them. I've also messed with the autoplay settings. I've Refreshed Firefox. I've uninstalled and re-installed Firefox twice. I made a new profile.

None of these have helped my issue.

Any other solutions would be greatly appreciated!
creator: tommyashwood013

title: How can I see my bookmark folders that are in the bookmark toolbar
content: Hi, I know I'm just missing something basic here, but coming from the Chrome world I'm having a tough time with the bookmarks. I can see those folders under the bookmarks toolbar in the bookmark manager, but I would love to just be able to click on the arrows on the end of the bookmarks toolbar and have them drop down just like they did in Chrome. Do I have it all wrong? Do I always have to have my bookmark manager open to be able to bounce from bookmark to bookmark? Thanks in advance for any help.
creator: ktothe2nd1

title: Active tab is NOT visible
content:
With the dark mode of Firefox on Windows 10 desktop it is IMPOSSIBLE to see which of the several tabs is the one that is open.

I work with tabs not windows as I always need to see all the pages/websites open that I work with in one view, and so it is a hassle and nuisance NOT to be able to tell which tab is active, having to click through each one or guess.

It's one of those small yet significantly impacting on the user experience things which one would have thought by now Firefox developers would fix.

The ACTIVE tab needs to be in different colour may be on a yellow background with dark font so that people can EASILY find it with several tabs open on the screen.

Any thoughts on this? is there perhaps an option to enable it - which I am oblivious to?

thanks
creator: etcetera777

creator: dianacau

title: Change to userchrome border rendering 113
content:
I just noticed that Windows Firefox version 113 changes how this userchrome border is rendered. 

#TabsToolbar-customization-target { 	border-bottom-width: 1px; 	border-bottom-style: solid; 	border-color: var(--tabs-border-color); }

On my accidental airgapped machine running 112 the border is properly rendered as 1px. But on all my machines running 113 it's being rendered as 0.566667 which is rounded down to 0. I also noticed that my separators between the tabs seem to be thinner.

Before I try to counter it by setting my css to use 2px which is interpreted as 1.7 and rounded down to 1, can you please tell me WHAT is going on? Thanks.

P.S. My userchrome.css include much more than this, hence why it looks strange on a default profile, but the effects are still visible.
creator: Funtime60

title: Can't open first pinned tab when FF window maximized
content:
When FF (113.0.1) is maximized clicking on the first (left hand) pinned tab does not open the tab. Hovering over the tab doesn't change the background color of the tab.

If I restore down the window, hovering over the tab changes the background color of the tab from light grey to a slightly darker grey and clicking the tab opens it.
creator: leg204
